intro: Gilia inconspicua var. deserti, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are typically pink to purple in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in restoration projects due to its resilience.
